title: Leicester Mercury published Financial firm entertains clients at Lords
text:
Comments (0) 
Staff, clients and friends of Pole Arnold Financial Management attended an investment briefing over afternoon tea at the House of Lords. 
The reception, which was primarily aimed at London clients, saw 120 guests enjoy a bright winter's afternoon of tea and cakes in the Cholmondeley Room and Terrace, overlooking the River Thames. 
Baroness Byford hosted the event in the Lords, on behalf of the wealth management business which is based in Narborough Wood Park, near Enderby. 
She also closed the afternoon with an enlightening talk on how the two Houses of Parliament work. 
Mike Pole, managing director of Pole Arnold, said: "It was a super event and clients really enjoyed the very special location for our investment briefing. 
"Last year we used The Gherkin, this year the House of Lords. 
"I am not quite sure what will be able to top that in 2017." 
Peter Bickley, economist for Pole Arnold, updated guests on the outlook for investment markets in light of the Brexit vote and President-elect Donald Trump. 
One of his key messages was that we live in uncertain times as he highlighted the benefits of a well-diversified and managed investment portfolio. 
Mr Pole said things in the morning had been tense because of major disruptions and cancellations on the Midland Mainline, but 14 members of the Pole Arnold team managed to get down to Westminster by road and rail.
